alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 10 at 2:44PM MDT until June 11 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT SUNDAY FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT MONDAY FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND THE SANDIA/MANZANO MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .An upper level low approaching from the west will spread strong south to southwest winds across parts of the region Sunday and Monday. The combination of strong winds with very low humidity, warm temperatures, and unstable conditions will create critical to locally extreme fire weather. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TO 7 PM MDT SUNDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 2 PM to 7 PM MDT Sunday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Monday afternoon through Monday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106) on Sunday and Monday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...South 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph on Sunday then southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph on Monday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...8 to 12% on Sunday and 6 to 10% on Monday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
